unnormalised: **Telecommunications Sector Sees Shift in Data Plan Consumption**
normalised: **Telecommunications Sector Sees Shift in Data Plan Consumption**

unnormalised: Mumbai, Oct 26 – Recent data from TRAI indicates a significant shift in mobile data plan usage across India. Average data consumption per user has risen by 15% in the last quarter, fueled by increased video streaming and online gaming, mirroring trends seen globally.
normalised: Mumbai, October twenty six – Recent data from T R A I indicates a significant shift in mobile data plan usage across India. Average data consumption per user has risen by fifteen percent in the last quarter, fueled by increased video streaming and online gaming, mirroring trends seen globally.

unnormalised: Telecom operators like Airtel and Jio are reportedly re-evaluating their data plan offerings to cater to this growing demand. Sources suggest new plans with higher data caps and bundled OTT subscriptions could be announced before Diwali.
normalised: Telecom operators like Airtel and Jio are reportedly re-evaluating their data plan offerings to cater to this growing demand. Sources suggest new plans with higher data caps and bundled O T T subscriptions could be announced before Diwali.

unnormalised: “We are seeing consumers prioritize data speed and reliability,” stated an analyst from IIM Ahmedabad. “The 'Gadar: Ek Prem Katha' re-release streaming marathon clearly shows how critical robust data plans are becoming for entertainment consumption."
normalised: “We are seeing consumers prioritize data speed and reliability,” stated an analyst from I I M Ahmedabad. “The 'Gadar: Ek Prem Katha' re-release streaming marathon clearly shows how critical robust data plans are becoming for entertainment consumption."

unnormalised: Industry experts predict a price correction in the coming months, with Jio possibly leading the charge to maintain market share. Concerns remain regarding network infrastructure capacity in Tier-II and Tier-III cities, requiring significant investment to keep pace with escalating data demands. Analysts estimate required network upgrades will cost telcos Rs. 1,500 Crore over the next year.
normalised: Industry experts predict a price correction in the coming months, with Jio possibly leading the charge to maintain market share. Concerns remain regarding network infrastructure capacity in Tier-I I and Tier-I I I cities, requiring significant investment to keep pace with escalating data demands. Analysts estimate required network upgrades will cost telcos rupee one thousand five hundred crore over the next year.
